`Import-PSSession` creates a in-memory proxy module. The module function lacks almost all parameters metadata (parameter sets, default values, required attributes and so on).
Found this while investigating https://github.com/PowerShell/platyPS/issues/338

Steps to reproduce
------------------

You would need a session to exchange, but any remote session should do https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/exchange/exchange-online/connect-to-exchange-online-powershell/connect-to-exchange-online-powershell?view=exchange-ps

```powershell
$Session = ... # create exchange server connection
Import-PSSession $Session
(Get-Command Add-AvailabilityAddressSpace).Definition
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

Parameters signatures (required, parameter sets, default values) should match the original functions.

Actual behavior
---------------

The generated `param()` block contains all the parameters in a single default parameter set, without any additional metadata. That makes it harder to reason about the actual module UX without the remote session roundtrip.

```powershell
param(
                          
                          [Alias('ov')]
                          ${OutVariable},
                      
                          ${Credentials},
                      
                          [Alias('pv')]
                          ${PipelineVariable},
                      
                          ${TargetAutodiscoverEpr},
                      
                          [Alias('vb')]
                          [switch]
                          ${Verbose},
                      
                          ${AccessMethod},
                      
                          [Alias('ob')]
                          ${OutBuffer},
                      
                          [Alias('wv')]
                          ${WarningVariable},
                      
                          [Alias('iv')]
                          ${InformationVariable},
                      
                          [Alias('wi')]
                          [switch]
                          ${WhatIf},
                      
                          [Alias('infa')]
                          ${InformationAction},
                      
                          [Alias('cf')]
                          [switch]
                          ${Confirm},
                      
                          [Alias('db')]
                          [switch]
                          ${Debug},
                      
                          ${ForestName},
                      
                          [Alias('ea')]
                          ${ErrorAction},
                      
                          [Alias('wa')]
                          ${WarningAction},
                      
                          [Alias('ev')]
                          ${ErrorVariable},
                      
                          [switch]
                          ${AsJob})
```

title: Import-PSModule proxy functions lack parameters metadata
